Quadrature Encoder Interface (QEI)
Stratify OS » Device Interface
Collaboration diagram for Quadrature Encoder Interface (QEI):

Detailed Description

The Quadrature Encoder Interface (QEI) provides to MCUs' hardware encoders used to monitor the speed and direction of motors and other rotary devices.

More information about accessing peripheral IO is in the Device Interface section.

Enumerations

Macro Definition Documentation

#define I_QEI_GET

This request reads the QEI position.

Example:

1 uint32_t value;
2 value = ioctl(qei_fd, I_QEI_READ);
#define I_QEI_GETINDEX

This request reads the QEI index counter.

Example:

1 int32_t index_pulses;
2 index_pulses = ioctl(qei_fd, I_QEI_GETINDEX);
#define I_QEI_GETVELOCITY

This request reads the QEI velocity.

Example:

1 int32_t velocity;
2 velocity = ioctl(qei_fd, I_QEI_GETVELOCITY);
#define I_QEI_RESET

This request resets the QEI position. The ctl argument is one or more qei_reset_mask_t values.

Example (resets the position and velocity but not the index count):

1 ioctl(qei_fd, I_QEI_RESETPOS, (QEI_RESET_POS|QEI_RESET_VELOCITY));

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum qei_action_event_mask_t

These are the events for qei_action_t.

Enumerator
QEI_ACTION_EVENT_INDEX 

A pulse on the index line

QEI_ACTION_EVENT_DIRCHANGE 

A change in direction

enum qei_mode_t

This defines the bits used in the "mode" member of qei_attr_t.

Enumerator
QEI_MODE_INVERT_DIR 

Invert the direction

QEI_MODE_SIGNAL_MODE 

Use signal mode

QEI_MODE_DOUBLE_EDGE 

Count both edges

QEI_MODE_INVERT_INDEX 

Invert the index

enum qei_reset_mask_t

This lists the bitmask used with the I_QEI_RESET request.

Enumerator
QEI_RESET_POS 

Reset the position

QEI_RESET_VELOCITY 

Reset the velocity

QEI_RESET_INDEX 

Reset the index count

QEI_RESET_POS_ONINDEX 

Reset the position on the next index pulse
